meanings.definition: To adjust the focus of a microscope so that different objectives can be interchanged without significant refocusing.
meanings.sent1: When parfocalizing, ensure the microscope stays focused when switching lenses.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often parfocalize to smoothly transition between different magnifications.
meanings.sent3: The biologist tried parfocalizing the microscope but ended up with a blurry view of the specimen.
meanings.sent4: Parfocalizing is like finding the perfect angle to view a painting without moving your head.
meanings.sent5: Remember to parfocalize carefully to avoid losing sight of the tiny details.

meanings.definition: The act of making adjustments to maintain a consistent focus while changing magnification levels.
meanings.sent1: Proper parfocalizing ensures a clear image when adjusting the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The technician's skillful parfocalizing kept the image sharp at all magnification levels.
meanings.sent3: The parfocalizing process felt like a delicate dance between clarity and precision.
meanings.sent4: Her parfocalizing ability was compared to a tightrope walker maintaining balance.
meanings.sent5: The importance of parfocalizing became evident when the image remained crisp throughout the experiment.
